stories.title: Pi Review – a website for PhD students to review their PIs

stories.text: I'm looking to learn more about formally specifying the requirements for a piece of software, modelling and simulating the design, and verifying its correctness with a proof assistant or model-checker. Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Books on formal methods for software verification?
I use attrs instead of pydantic

stories.text:
How did you make the switch from frontend, backend, mobile, games, ML, embedded, desktop etc. to any of the other domains on the list?

How did you bridge the gap in skills? Did you have problems with not having any commercial experience in the new domain? Did you have to take a pay cut?

It would be great to hear people's experience with this. Any tips and general advice are also appreciated.
stories.title: Ask HN: What was your experience switching domains within the software industry?
